items.description:

As always, thanks to all the contributors!

items.title: Fiddler for Xamarin Devs
items.description:
Fiddler is the beloved network proxy for countless developers. We look under the covers to explore how Fiddler can benefit mobile developers. Developers should never be in doubt as to what happens in the network stack.

Fiddler for Xamarin Devs by Sam Basu
items.description_markdown:
Fiddler is the beloved network proxy for countless developers. We look under the covers to explore how Fiddler can benefit mobile developers. Developers should never be in doubt as to what happens in the network stack.

items.title: White Labeling your Applications
items.description:
White Labelling is having an app with a consistent codebase but supporting multiple brands simply by configuring the application with the desired branding.

items.title: An Alert From the ViewModel
items.description: Quite often we want to send an alert from the view model, but you can only do so from the view. We‚Äôve tackled this problem in the past but we think there is room for a simplified and clear step by step explanation. An Alert From the ViewModel by Jesse Liberty

items.title: Create your own circular progress bar using skiasharp
items.description:
The circular progress bar is a very popular control that designers like to use in mobile apps, also the control popularity it is not a part of the official SDKs for all the mobile platforms (IOS, Android and windows). Here is how to create your own using SKiaSharp.

Create your own circular progress bar using skiasharp by Ahmed Fouad
items.description_markdown:
The circular progress bar is a very popular control that designers like to use in mobile apps, also the control popularity it is not a part of the official SDKs for all the mobile platforms (IOS, Android and windows). Here is how to create your own using SKiaSharp.

[**Create your own circular progress bar using skiasharp**](https://itnext.io/create-your-own-circular-progress-bar-using-skiasharp-7c3f5616a754) by [Ahmed Fouad](https://itnext.io/@csharpwriter)

items.title: Merge Conflict 204 - Going Freemium
items.description:
When the app store first started paid apps were the standard, but now it is all about freemium and subscriptions. James walks through his latest dilemma with his Animal Crossing app and how he tried to figure out if he could profit from a freemium model.

204: Going Freemium by soundbite.fm
items.description_markdown:
When the app store first started paid apps were the standard, but now it is all about freemium and subscriptions. James walks through his latest dilemma with his Animal Crossing app and how he tried to figure out if he could profit from a freemium model.

[**204: Going Freemium**](https://www.mergeconflict.fm/204) by [soundbite.fm]()

items.title: TinyMvvm 2.2 ‚Äì Shell Navigation Updates
items.description:
We have mentioned TinyMvvm before. It's got an update which adds support for passing parameters when navigating with ShellNavigationHandler. You can now use both query parameters and passing a object as a parameter.

TinyMvvm 2.2 ‚Äì Shell Navigation Updates by dhindrik
items.description_markdown:
We have mentioned TinyMvvm before.  It's got an update which adds support for passing parameters when navigating with ShellNavigationHandler. You can now use both query parameters and passing a object as a parameter.

[**TinyMvvm 2.2 ‚Äì Shell Navigation Updates**](https://danielhindrikes.se/index.php/2020/06/04/tinymvvm-2-2-shell-navigation-updates/) by [dhindrik](https://danielhindrikes.se/index.php/author/dhindrik/)
